thread.title: Couple's powerful pregnancy announcement reveals their 953 day struggle to conceive
thread.title_full: Couple's powerful pregnancy announcement reveals their 953 day struggle to conceive - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Couple's powerful pregnancy announcement reveals their 953 day struggle to conceive
text:
Couple's powerful pregnancy announcement reveals their 953 day struggle to conceive The happy couple are expecting twins - after a very long wait Share Comments By Zoe Forsey 15:01, 16 FEB 2017 Updated 15:03, 16 FEB 2017 News Lauren and Garyt Walker shared a powerful image on Facebook (Photo: Facebook) Share Comments Get Pregnancy announcements are becoming more and more creative as expecting parents think of new clever, cute and sometimes downright odd ways to share their news.
But how do you tell the world you're expecting if your journey to conceive has been far from ordinary?
Lauren and Garyt Walker, from Houston, Texas, couldn't decided how to share their happy news with family and friends.
They've faced an incredibly long wait - 953 days to be exact - to get to this point.
In that time they have been through two rounds of IVF , four clomid/letrozole attempts, three failed transfers, one corrective surgery and at least 452 needles - and thousands of tears along the way.
So when it came to breaking the news, they knew they wanted to do something special.
"Everything we could think of fell short of doing them justice. Doing ourselves justice, for every trial and tribulation we have been through these past years", writes Lauren.
But their final idea is incredibly powerful and perfectly highlights the trials, struggles and heartbreak that can come with not being able to conceive naturally.
The couple's post on Facebook (Photo: Facebook) The photo shows two adorable baby grows surrounded by all the needles and medication that made their dreams of becoming parents a reality.
Have you revealed your pregnancy in an unusual way? Share your story below.
Alongside the photo Lauren has penned an extremely honest account of what the couple have been through.
She also admits it was not easy to take the photo.
She writes: "Taking out these needles by the handful to take this photograph was... surreal.
"Half way through my hands started to quiver, my breath got short, and I had to stop. I sat down, looked at it and started to cry.
"Not because I was sad about what it took to get here, but because it was a representation of my world, our world, for the past over two and a half years staring back at me.
"There was a lot of pain, hope, and fear behind each of these needles. Each one represents a different day, a different path, a different emotion. It's a lot to take in.
"After a good cry, the more I looked at it, the more the needles started to blur together.
"Now all I see are these tiny onesies that so perfectly sum up our journey: Worth the wait. And wait, and wait, and wait."
Little Duke and Diana Walker are due in August - and Lauren and Garyt couldn't be more excited.
"Mommy and Daddy cannot wait to hold you in our arms, for we have carried you in our hearts for a lifetime."
